author: adarkerlink

text: Haven't had much of a chance to thoroughly Â test all of his moves (still getting used to the controls), but I can tell you his down smash has great crowd control and launching ability.
author: EvilMariobot

text:
@adarkerlink
It's a decent move, just a bit predictable. Besides, the new Smash Bros. is definitely more focused on the ground combat, so aerials likely won't be used as often as ground-based attacks, even if Megaman has some pretty good ones.

In general, according to most people, Megaman is definitely the worst character in the demo by match-ups.
(Yes, I said in the DEMO. He's just not as effective against the characters available in it, this might very well change in the actual game.)

text: Nintendo's whole campaign relies on remixes.
author: Obby

text: I'd like to relax on a moonlit beach with this playing.
author: Doughboy123x

text: Unsurprisingly, the latest Smash game has a packed soundtrack full of quality tracks and remixes. This short theme is super relaxing so I had to upload it and add it to the Relaxin' playlist. But yeah, some of the remixes are especially solid so expect to see some of those in this list as well. The 3DS version just sold close to 1 million copies in its first week, it's great to see the series still be so popular. On that note, I'm glad Nintendo is finally supporting (and hosting) fighting tournaments with Smash, viewing those streams is always a good time.
